Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
CAN: The student might be able to draw basic shapes representing a simple habitat like a playground, although details would be lacking or incorrect.
The student may include one or two simple representations of living things, such as stick-figure animals or simple tree shapes, but not correctly place them in a specific context.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to correctly draw specific habitats like pond or stream environments (student might not understand different habitat types).

The student is unlikely to accurately illustrate a variety of living things in each habitat (the student may misunderstand what types of living things belong in each habitat, like drawing a fish on land).
The student might not be able to compare or show diversity of living things in the drawings (student might draw similar looking animals or fail to distinguish plant types).
The student would likely not demonstrate patterns in where different plants and animals live (student probably places everything randomly without showing habitat specificity).
